title: Arsenal fans hurl abuse at Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as he drives away in Lamborghini
text:

Arsenal fans have been caught on camera abusing Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang after their draw with Crystal Palace - hours after booing off captain Granit Xhaka as tensions ran high at the Emirates.

Gunners supporters sparked an angry reaction from Xhaka as he was withdrawn in the second half of a disappointing game in north London.

But he wasn't the only player in the firing line, with footage emerging of Aubameyang being told to "f*** off" by some of his own fans whilst travelling home from the game.

Aubameyang, one of Arsenal's star players, was stuck in traffic in his chrome Lamborghini Aventador when he was approached by a handful of fans.

One can be heard shouting: "£2,000 a year to watch s***… f*** off!" whilst another adds: "These people pay £1,800 for a season ticket… they are your support!"

Whilst frustrations aired at Xhaka came after a tough run of form, Aubameyang has been amongst Arsenal's best performers both last season and this season under Emery.

A number of other Arsenal fans questioned why he was in the firing line, with one writing: "Don’t take your frustrations out on a player who’s saved us, who’s won us games in clutch moments. Blame Emery."

Another stated: "I’m honestly ashamed watching videos of fans shouting abuse at Aubameyang as he attempted to drive home after the match on Sunday.

"Arguably our most dependable performer, who knows where we’d be without him. He deserves much, much better than that. We’re sorry, @Aubameyang7 ."

Aubameyang has already found the back of the net eight times in 12 games this term, but reports suggest he could opt to leave the club this summer in search of Champions League football if they cannot get back into the top four.

Another fan added: "Weird she’s shouting it at the player that’s bailed us out on numerous occasions already this season."

Sunday's draw leaves the Gunners four points adrift of fourth placed Chelsea having missed a major opportunity with two slip-ups in their last two Premier League games.

(Image: PETER POWELL/EPA-EFE/REX)

The Gunners will take on Liverpool in Carabao Cup action tonight (Wednesday) with Xhaka and Aubameyang amongst those who have not travelled to Anfield.

Mesut Ozil is in the frame to make his first appearance since the win over Nottingham Forest in the last round as Emery rings the changes and hands several fringe players in his squad a chance to impress.
description: The abuse came after Granit Xhaka's emotional reaction to being booed off by Arsenal fans against Crystal Palace on Sunday
